title: Order of MNIST images depends on n_neurons in supervised_mnist.py example?!
body:
While I was trying out different hyper parameter configurations for the supervised_mnist.py example, I noticed a peculiar thing:
When running the example with the same hyper parameters, the order of MNIST example images would always be the same, i.e. when looking at the labels after update_interval images, it would always be the same sequence of numbers. So far nothing weird, when running with seed = 0, i.e. the execution being deterministic.
However, when I change only the number of `neurons n_neurons`, this sequence of labels changes.
E.g. when running with the parameter configuration `--n_clamp 0 --intensity 170 --inh 60 --n_neurons X --n_train 1000 --n_test 0 --time 40 --update_interval 50`
for 

- X = 80 I would get the sequence of labels 3, 7, 6, 2, 7, 1, 9, 0, 5, 7, 5, 1, ...

- X = 100 I would get 0, 4, 1, 8, 6, 4, 6, 4, 6, 7, 0, 7, ...

- X = 120 I would get 9, 1, 7, 9, 7, 8, 0, 9, 0, 3, 4, 9, ...

etc. 
This does not make any sense to me as, in my understanding, `n_neurons` is neither used in loading or preparing the dataset, nor in choosing images from it, nor is it used as a random seed or the like. 
Does anyone have an idea why this could be happening? (And if not: Might this be an issue inherent to PyTorch?) 
I would greatly appreciate an answer :).

Kind regards

P.S. I made sure to use the newest version of BindsNET when trying this out
